column4: GUYS, how can I boot from CD in grub when the system starts up?
usually change your bios to look for cd first
I did set boot priorities to CD, but it does not boot from CD
maybe the cds not bootable
it should be...
nopers, means they did away with inittab :)
look in /etc/event.d/
inittab isn't present in /etc/event.d
no, because upstart doesn't use inittab, it uses scripts
So why don't I have inittab file at all?
cos edgy uses upstart
whereis that upstart? Like I want to check the boot level, where do I see that?
just 'runlevel' will do that, but to change default bootlevel, well hmm..
check /etc/event.d/rc-default
it doesn't say how to change the default run level

I also saw very few (like 2 or 3)  messages on startup, until I removed 'quite' in the menu.lst where it said 'quite splash' IS THIS OK??? I mean is it OK that I did not see many messages like starting dns, starting dhcp, starting mysqld, etc...
that's what quiet does
I'm in the middle of either something is wrong with my system OR that's how it should be... I'm clueless right now
no /etc/inittab on edgy is the default
because before I had Hoary and later upgraded to edgy. That had inittab. BUT now i reformated the HDD and installed fresh edgy.
correct - no inittab is needed for a default edgy install
